title.value: Silent Bugs in Deep Learning Frameworks: An Empirical Study of Keras and TensorFlow
title.justification: Extracted from the title section of the research paper.
title.quote: Silent Bugs in Deep Learning Frameworks: An Empirical Study of Keras and TensorFlow

extractions.description: The paper presents an empirical study analyzing silent bugs in the TensorFlow deep learning framework, specifically its high-level API Keras, and their impacts on users' programs. It categorizes these bugs and assesses their threat levels based on user feedback from an online survey.

type.justification: The paper conducts an empirical study targeting the characteristics and impacts of silent bugs in TensorFlow and Keras, using data collected from the TensorFlow repository and feedback from a survey.
type.quote: This paper presents the first empirical study of the silent bugs in Tensorflow, specifically its high-level API Keras, and their impact on users’ programs.

name.justification: The paper deals with bugs in deep learning frameworks, specifically targeting TensorFlow and its API, Keras.
name.quote: Deep Learning (DL) frameworks such as TensorFlow [8, 10], Keras [5], Pytorch [6], MLlib [43], and Jax [33] are becoming more and more popular to develop sophisticated and complex applications in various domains; from face recognition, fraud detection in financial companies, diagnosis and treatment of diseases, and natural language processing to autonomous vehicles.

name.justification: The focus of the paper is on analyzing bugs within the deep learning frameworks, particularly silent bugs.
name.quote: This paper deals with the subcategory of bugs named silent bugs: they lead to wrong behavior but they do not cause system crashes or hangs, nor show an error message to the user.

name.justification: The study categorizes silent bugs and assesses their impact through an empirical study and an online survey with deep learning developers.
name.quote: We categorized the bugs based on the effects on the users’ programs and the components where the issues occurred, using information from the issue reports. We then derived a threat level for each of the issues, based on the impact they had on the users’ programs. To assess the relevance of identified categories and the impact scale, we conducted an online survey with 103 DL developers.

name.justification: The paper studies silent bugs within the TensorFlow framework.
name.quote: We studied how they manifest in the users’ code, what parts of the API are affected and what are their causes. As the main motivation of this work is to study the impact of silent bugs on DL framework users’ programs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Tensorflow: A system for large-scale machine learning
referenced_paper_title.justification: TensorFlow is the primary framework studied in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: TensorFlow is an end-to-end, open-source ML platform [10]. Dataflow graphs are used to define the computations, operations, and states of ML algorithms.

name.justification: The paper analyzes silent bugs in TensorFlow’s high-level API, Keras.
name.quote: We extracted closed issues related to Keras API from the TensorFlow GitHub repository. Out of the 1,168 issues that we gathered, 77 were reproducible silent bugs affecting users’ programs.

referenced_paper_title.value: Keras: The Python Deep Learning library
referenced_paper_title.justification: Keras is the specific API of TensorFlow studied in the paper.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Keras is a set of DL APIs developed in Python that runs on top of the TensorFlow ML framework [5].
